name: Career Development Association of Singapore (CDAS)
description: With the current volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) environment, Singapore workforce needs to adapt, unlearn and relearn for future growth. Career development is an important process to support such lifelong career transformation. No matter where you are in your career, chances are you're in need a little support to get to the next step—to go for the job you'll actually love waking up for, to find meanings in the things you do, or to just push through a rough day. Career development can support you to better manage the changing life, learning, and work. More career practitioners are needed to support the workforce transformation in Singapore in the coming years.The Career Development Association of Singapore (CDAS) was founded in 2018 by a group of passionate practitioners who saw the needs to support the growing career development practitioners community and to promote professionalism in the industry.
features: Networking Opportunities are available for career development practitioners from different work settings
Availability to use post-nominal designation: CDAS (G), CDAS (A), CDAS (P), and CDAS (F)
Free sign-up for NTUC Social membership
Headline:
Prepare your CAREER on the path to success
 Discover. Strategize. Action.
ShortDescription: Career development associates helps in finding new jobs and provides recruitment services to organisation.
enhanced_description: The Career Development Association of Singapore (CDAS), established in 2018, is a professional body founded by passionate practitioners to support the evolving career development landscape in Singapore. Recognizing the need for the Singapore workforce to adapt and transform in a volatile and complex environment, CDAS focuses on nurturing and professionalizing the community of career development practitioners. The association provides valuable networking opportunities for practitioners across various work settings and offers professional recognition through post-nominal designations (CDAS (G), CDAS (A), CDAS (P), CDAS (F)). By fostering a strong, professional practitioner community, CDAS aims to indirectly support lifelong career transformation for individuals, help in finding new jobs, provide recruitment services to organizations, and ultimately contribute to improved employee happiness and engagement across the Singapore workforce. Members also benefit from a free sign-up for NTUC Social membership.
key_use_cases: Professional networking for career development practitioners
Gaining professional recognition and credibility through post-nominal designations
Promoting professionalism within the career development industry in Singapore
Facilitating career strategy and action for job seekers
Indirectly supporting talent acquisition and recruitment services for organizations
competitive_advantages: Offers official post-nominal designations for professional recognition and credibility
Provides dedicated networking opportunities for career development practitioners in Singapore
Focuses on promoting professionalism and community within the career development industry
roi_benefits: Enhanced professional standing and credibility for career development practitioners
Improved networking and collaboration opportunities for practitioners
Contribution to the professionalization and standardization of the career development industry
Support for lifelong career transformation and adaptability of the Singapore workforce
Improvement in employee happiness and engagement
